reviews.sentence: A fabulous hotel with an excellent location beautiful street and close proximity to retail restaurants and two Metro stops. The bed was incredible and my sleep made even more perfect by the pillows. The complimentary evening wine reception morning coffee and choice of newspapers were much appreciated too. All that plus great service and the incredible rate I got will definitely mean a repeat visit.

Hotel rogue is a great hotel. I really enjoyed my stay. The staff is very helpful and informative. Checking in was simple and quick. As far as parking goes there is not a lot and hard to find. Overnight valet is 50 and day parking is 25. The hotel itself is very clean the hallways smell like cleaning products which is a good sign. The rooms are very spacious and the beds are very comfortable. The food is great as well pricey but worth it. As far as touring and attractions your within walking distance of food and things to do except most museums. Overall I really enjoyed my stay. I would recommend hotel rouge to anyone.

Big rooms good location. I stayed here with a group of girls for a weekend getaway. I was a little aprehensive at first of putting 12 girls in only 3 rooms but I must say the rooms were quite large and not at all cramped. The rooms were very modern and for the most part clean. One room had ants everywhere but that group was quickly moved. The bathroom was on the smaller size. They had shampoo conditioner body wash on pumps on the wall instead of mini travel bottles. Great idea. but I needed about 94 pumps before I had enough of anything. The location was great we could walk everywhere. One huge gripe with the hotel was that they charged for Internet. it is 2015 make it free. Also no coffee maker in the rooms but free coffee in the lobby. Free wine and snacks in the lobby from 5 6pm also a nice touch. I love Kimptons and would recommend this one to friends.

Absolutely perfect. It was my sons graduation weekend from Johns Hopkins and it was so convenient to Georgetown where he lives and to the Graduation at DAR Convention Hall. Staff was helpful with directions and cab service. Great coffee. Comfortable bed umbrela ended up a must. big comfortable room clean QUIET convenient great staff. Chairs not comfortable. My only complaint.

A Beautiful Base Touring Wonderful Washington DCWe took DC Metro Red Line from Union Station toward Shady Grove and got off at Farragut North Metro Station from there we walked toward east to 16th St NW and make a left heading north for about 80 meter passed Scott Circle and stayed on 16th St and the Rouge Hotel is on the right hand side. Kiah checked us in professionally and gave a very nice room 216 on the 2nd floor. The room was really spacious clean with nice furniture and all in a “ Rouge ” tone that was very interesting. Free Wi Fi was included with Kimpton member email log in. Wi Fi signal was very good and the speed was rather fast. Kiah nicely reminded us the happy wine hour from 5 to 6 pm that many had good reviews but we did n’t try it this time since we fall asleep on those 2 comfy queen beds immediately after checked in. Next time we will definitely give it a try. Complimentary morning coffee in the lobby that was an A PlusThe location of the hotel is great for tourists so close to many attractions such as White house National Mall Lincoln Memorial etc. …. The second morning with a beautiful weather we walked all the way from the hotel to the White House and walked along the National Mall and then arrived Union station to go back to NYC. That was really a nice route touring beautiful Washington DC area. Overall we enjoyed the convenient location of Rouge Hotel and quiet spacious clean and comfy room 216 and definitely would recommend it as a wonderful base touring Capital area飯店前台Kiah很親切快速的安排我們入住一個在二樓的安靜套房216 房間非常的大有兩張Quen beds裝潢與家具都是紅色系很有趣 用Kimpton的註冊電郵Log in就可以享受免費Wi Fi 速度與訊號都很不錯呢. 傍晚五點到六點有免費的Wine hour我們這次竟然睡過頭沒享受到 不過網評超優下次一定要去試這個飯店離地鐵站紅線Faragut North站步行大概十來分鐘 離大部分的景點只要天氣許可幾乎都用走的都能到 我們第二天早上就全程步行先到白宮然後走到華盛頓紀念碑沿著National Mal往東走最後走回聯合火車站搭車返回紐約 這是很棒的一個步行導覽路線呢總而言之 這個Rouge飯店是暢遊導覽華府很好的一個基地 要房間記得最好不要向著大馬路16th St 會比較吵 room 216朝著裡面的巷子非常安靜喔Stayed October 2015 traveled as a couple.
Great stay. Very stylish. Wine happy hourOnly 1 elevator was working.

Red Velvet drape as closet door opens to find leopard print bath robe. Loved the small quaint reception area adjacent to the front desk. Complimentary evening wine gives one the opportunity to meet other interesting travelers. Rooms are large and baths are extra spacious. I had DND on door during my two day stay and passing maid in the hallway she asked if she could freshen my room. Nice personal touch.

Lovely stay. This hotel is a great find not to far away from the attractions ie White House Lincoln memorial etcit is room are large king size bed 2 comfortable chairs long desk. The bar restaurant is small but big enough always find room. The only thing it does lack is tea coffee facilities in the room. You do get free tea coffee in the lobby in the morning free wine 5 6 in the evening all in all it is great fab hotel would stay again.

Excellent hotel. Wonderfully decorated and perfectly positioned for the main attractions in DC. 34 blocks up from the White House which leads over the Ellipse to the National Mall the Washington Monument the Lincoln Memorial and the Capitol Building. Within walking distance of all the museums off the Mall too. The hotel offered great service a free coffee service in the lobby most of the morning and a free wine house 530pm til 630pm I think. The staff were all very friendly the desk staff were happy attentive and efficient. The room was spacious and clean. The maid service was very very discreet. I never saw them Just the fantastic results of their hard work. can not recommend this hotel highly enough.

Good Location Friendly Hotel. Stayed here for a two night break. The Hotel is in an excellent position for walking around the main tourist attractions if you like walking. It is also not far from the hop on hop off bus routes which can take you further afield. We went to Chinatown for a meal and had a pleasant walk back to the hotel the first evening and then we are spoilt for choice on 14th Street and ate in the Hilton Garden Restaurant also within close proximity. The room was large with very comfy beds. The theme could do with updating possibly a change of curtains the red velvet was faded in our room but nothing offensive about them. Very small bathroom but clean and tidy so does the job. One major plus to the hotel Rouge well done for actually having bath towels that fit around an average sized woman with boobs. it is the little things in life that countFacilities are great everything you could possibly need provided in the room plus a list of things you can borrow or buy. If it is not in the list they will also try to get you it and I believe they would within reason. We requested coffee making facilities in the room on arrival and it was there on our return. We had breakfast in the restaurant one continental and one cooked both delicious and reasonably priced. All the staff were very friendly the cleaner Ziola apologies if I have remembered that wrong. gave you a warm welcome in the morning and left the room spotless and Sarah in reception was particularly helpful with maps directions and recommendations. Overall we had a great stay and whilst not perfect they are getting the important things right. I would recommend this for a city break.

The Place was OK. it is not the best of places. High Priced. No comforters on the Beds only sheets. Charged for Hotel Amenities What Amenities. The Gentleman that Checked me in was very miserable. Tried to make conversation to not feel awkward however he just did not seem to have that customer friendly attitude. When I tried to ask a few questions regarding the accommodations etc. all he kept repeating was your name please.

Icky and worn out. Past its prime. Chiped paint on every surface. Dented scratched elevators. Nasty old moldy bathrooms. Broken bed. Worn out linens. No empty outlets for electronics. No usb ports. Hallways littered with food trays. We also had a hard time at check in. Bar oddly closed before 10 pm. Not up to Kimptons usual high standards.

Amazingly large room with ample and accessible power plugs for phones etc. Additionally clean rooms and friendly staff. However only 1 working elevator so be ready to take an excruciatingly LONG TIME to get to your room.

A 10 minute walk from the Farragut North Metro station well kept property. They are upgrading elevators Nov 2018 but have really clever ways of acknowledging the disruption like riddles in elevator lobbies and IHG points for getting a certain of steps a day to encourage usage if stairs.

Needs updating. Older hotel in desperate need of updates. One elevator was out of service leaving only one elevator running for the entire building. We ended up taking the stairs 5th FL since the wait times were so long. Tv in room was small and far away from the bed. Curtains were torn and did not close all the way. There was no soap or any toiletries in the room. Too few towels and not enough pillows.

Fine then terrible. I stayed three days at this hotel and got a great room thought it was a cute boutique hotel have always been into the Kimpton brand. but three days in I have to ask if it just better to stay at a Hilton or Mariot. At least it ’s boring but consistent. Staff works hard are friendly and want to make your stay great. But you get this uneasy feeling they ’ve been told by management to nickel and dime you. And it shows. Not only do they charge a fee on top of your rate the internet will go down the elevators wo n’t work and it ’s like you live in a spacious yet faulty apartment. The hotel responded accordingly for each problem experienced within the three days by paying for a breakfast and saying they wo n’t charge for internet but each offered after blatant complaints of internet going down or elevators malfunctioning. Nothing was offered or acknowledged prior to complaints and that ’s the terrible bit. This hotel is responsive not proactive and thus feels like is out to get you and they are n’t hiding stuff so beware — it feels unsavory because of all the things they are hiding rather than taking a 20 hit and acknowledging errors. A shame for the property staff and brand for which I had higher regard.

SCAM. Hidden Fees for Amenities. I stayed at the Kimpton Rouge Hotel for two nights this February. Upon checking out I was charged an additional 30 night for “ amenities ” fee. Firstly I was never informed about this fee and secondly. what amenities. I asked the front desk what amenities I was being charged for and they said for coffee tea in the lobby wifi and the fitness center. I was told the coffee tea and wifi were complimentary and what kind of hotel charges for instant coffee tea packs. The packs are literally less than 5 cents each and I would have just used my phone data for internet if I had to pay for wifi. Additionally the “ fitness center ” is abysmal. It is literally no exaggeration the size of two bathroom stalls. It has one treadmill one small bench and a couple of light dumbbells. All the amenities were worthless and useless. If you ’re going to hit me with a hidden fee for amenities at least have the amenities to back it up. What an embarrassment.

This hotel was probably nice 15 years ago. It s worn down and tacky now. They advertise free continental breakfast it s literally muffins cheerios and coco puffs. They advertise free wifi and a gym which is the saddest gym i ve ever seen. Also they will then surprise you with a 26 night amenity fee at the end of your stay to use previously mentioned free amenities. Housekeeping came to our hotel room at 4 pm on Saturday to do our room right when we got home from the day out and wanted to rest.

Rundown hotel but great staff. I am writing this review as a warning for Kimpton loyalists like myself because I wish I had read an honest review of this property before choosing this particular Kimpton in DC. I love the brand and am usually happy with their unique buildings and cool design choices. but this hotel does not meet the usual standard at all. BUT I do want to say upfront there is a happy ending to my review thanks to the exceptional customer service provided by staff there particularly the manager Sara. She was great. When I first arrived I was surprised how small the hotel lobby is with no real restaurant or bar contrary to advertising. I was immediately put off by the very dated red sparkle floor tiles and niteclub vibe they were going for and then stepped into an elevator with a damaged floor and a moldy smell. The hallways were the same a musty smell and dark stuffy feel. Then I walked into my Exec King room where I notice 1 the furniture is old and beat up frayed couch nicks and dents in all the tables nightstands etc. 2 the bathroom is TINY with no counter at all motel size with a door that had water damage and had been repainted MANY times did not even want to touch it 3 a 32 old TV not even flatscren. which looked like an ipad relative to the room and distance from the bed AND they have NO TV smart services like movies or hotel functions just a few channels from DirectTV. not ok with me 4 most rooms have a less than great view of the back of the hotel not vital. but you should be aware of this i kept my blinds down the whole time 5. the room is huge but there is just lots of unused empty space with no chairs table or anything useful placed in thereI was depressed thinking of staying there three nights one night i could have survived. so I called Kimptons main number online they connected me to guest services who were very nice and told me to talk to the property manager on duty to request they find me a room at another Kimpton property nearby. I did this and Sara the manager tried to help but said all the rooms elsewhere were booked up for my nights. BUT she then offered me a prototype renovated room they had which was FANTASTIC. The renovation will be fabulous wood floors dining table BIG TV still no services FYI cocktail bar setup HUGE glass walled bathroom with gorgeous freestanding tub huge shower counterspace for 2 plush couch etc etc amazing. My stay from that point on was all good and I applaud them for managing my situation so well. And the little bar they have is really only to service guests and for breakfast wine hour NOT a place to hang out at night or bring people to and they have no restaurant while other properties do. In conclusion I would only say to travelers to maybe wait until the hotel undergoes a full refurb before staying there over other Kimpton properties in DC.

Great Stay. Resort Fee unwarranted. Nice hotel in good location. 15blocks from Metro. The Lobby needs TLC. Staff really attentive and friendly. Especially Carlos and the folks in housekeeping. There was a doorman lobby attendant that was really attentive too. RESORT FEE. this is not a resort. If you want 400 extra. just put it in the rate. A resort is a self contained property with multiple restaurants and a unique entertaining feature like an amusement park or beach. Exactly what are you supplementing with this resort fee. You are not justified in charging this fee.
